query: What is the AI app that changes the language of videos?

[{"type":"search_result_group","domain":"www.gamesradar.com","entries":[{"type":"search_result","url":"https://www.gamesradar.com/entertainment/anime-shows/amazon-is-seemingly-doubling-down-on-its-ai-anime-dubs-despite-backlash-but-deletes-job-listing-to-drive-global-expansion-of-ai-enabled-dubbing-capabilities-after-less-than-a-week/","title":"Amazon is seemingly doubling down on its AI anime dubs, despite backlash - but deletes job listing to "drive global expansion of AI-enabled dubbing capabilities" after less than a week","snippet":"Amazon appears to be continuing its push into AI-generated anime dubbing despite negative feedback from viewers. Recently, the company posted a job listing for a Creative Director of Dubbing to help lead the expansion of its AI-enabled dubbing capabilities globally, particularly for content like anime, documentaries, and live-action. The role focused on developing hybrid workflows combining AI efficiency with artistic and culturally sensitive storytelling. However, the job listing was quickly taken down—less than 24 hours after it was reported by Anime Corner and only five days after being posted.

This move follows backlash Amazon received in December 2025 for using an AI-generated English dub for the anime *Banana Fish*, which was criticized for poor quality and subsequently removed. Other anime titles such as *Pet*, *No Game, No Life Zero*, and Spanish dubs for *Banana Fish* and *Vinland Saga* have also used AI-generated voices. While Amazon is advancing its investment in this technology, it continues to face scrutiny from audiences over the authenticity and quality of AI-dubbed content.","ref_id":{"turn_index":0,"ref_type":"news","ref_index":27},"pub_date":1769426608,"attribution":"www.gamesradar.com"}]},{"type":"search_result_group","domain":"www.heygen.com","entries":[{"type":"search_result","url":"https://www.heygen.com/translate","title":"AI Video Translator – Translate Videos into 175+ Languages - HeyGen","snippet":"Upload your video and automatically translate into 175+ different languages and dialects using AI-cloned voices, accurate lip sync, and subtitles.","ref_id":{"turn_index":0,"ref_type":"search","ref_index":0},"pub_date":null,"attribution":"www.heygen.com"}]},{"type":"search_result","url":"https://speechify.com/dubbing/?srsltid=AfmBOop2GNQlI563gz-ICOtfY16FUkz36WYtsJcrBlKFpfiZxb1JWL58","title":"AI Dubbing Online For Video Localization: Try For Free! | Speechify","snippet":"AI Dubbing allows you to automatically dub your existing or new videos into multiple languages. Powered by advanced AI, ...Read more","ref_id":{"turn_index":0,"ref_type":"search","ref_index":26},"pub_date":null,"attribution":"apps.apple.com"},{"type":"search_result_group","domain":"www.theverge.com","entries":[{"type":"search_result","url":"https://www.theverge.com/news/761665/meta-ai-translation-facebook-instagram-reels","title":"Meta's AI translation tool can dub your Instagram videos","snippet":"Meta is expanding its AI translation tool to more users on Facebook and Instagram, allowing automatic dubbing of reels between English and Spanish. The tool utilizes AI to generate voiceovers matching the user’s voice and mouth movements. To use it, creators can activate the "Translate voices with Meta AI" toggle before publishing a reel. The feature also supports optional lip-syncing and allows review before sharing. Translated reels are automatically shown to users in their preferred language and are marked with a disclosure tag indicating AI translation. The rollout is currently available to Facebook creators with at least 1,000 followers and all public Instagram accounts.","ref_id":{"turn_index":0,"ref_type":"news","ref_index":39},"pub_date":1755628093,"attribution":"www.theverge.com"}]},{"type":"search_result","url":"https://www.theverge.com/2025/1/9/24339817/vlc-player-automatic-ai-subtitling-translation","title":"VLC player demos real-time AI subtitling for videos","snippet":"At CES 2025, the open-source VLC media player showcased a new AI-powered feature that enables real-time subtitling and translation of videos directly on users' devices. Presented by VideoLAN President Jean-Baptiste Kempf, the demo highlighted the use of open-source AI models to generate and translate subtitles into over 100 languages completely offline, ensuring privacy and eliminating the need for cloud services. This feature is built directly into the VLC app, distinguishing it from earlier plug-ins that relied on platforms like OpenAI's Whisper. While the full rollout date hasn't been disclosed, the advancement demonstrates a significant leap in local AI integration for media playback. Additionally, VideoLAN announced that VLC has surpassed 6 billion downloads and continues to grow in active users despite the rise of streaming services.","ref_id":{"turn_index":0,"ref_type":"news","ref_index":41},"pub_date":1736431670,"attribution":"www.theverge.com"},{"type":"search_result_group","domain":"www.androidcentral.com","entries":[{"type":"search_result","url":"https://www.androidcentral.com/apps-software/youtube/youtubes-new-trick-automatically-re-dubs-any-video-into-your-native-tongue","title":"YouTube's new trick automatically re-dubs any video into your native tongue","snippet":"YouTube has launched a new multi-language audio feature that allows millions of creators to add dubbed audio tracks to their videos, significantly breaking down language barriers and expanding global reach. After two years of testing, the feature is now broadly available and uses Google’s Gemini AI to create translations that mimic the creator’s voice and emotional tone, helping make the dubs sound natural.

Creators can choose between manual dubbing — using their own or professional voiceovers — or automatic dubbing, which uses machine translation and synthetic voices. Automatic dubbing is enabled by default for eligible channels, with an option to review and approve dubs before publishing. Currently, English videos can be auto-translated into Japanese, Hindi, Spanish, and Korean, with more languages coming soon.

Management of audio tracks is handled via YouTube Studio, giving creators control over which dubs to publish or delete. The feature was initially tested with select creators like MrBeast and Jamie Oliver, and the results showed major success — Jamie Oliver’s viewership tripled after implementing dubbed audio. For viewers, the update means easier, more immersive access to international content without relying on subtitles.","ref_id":{"turn_index":0,"ref_type":"news","ref_index":44},"pub_date":1758022398,"attribution":"www.androidcentral.com"}]},{"type":"search_result","url":"https://arxiv.org/abs/2412.03878","title":"DiffSign: AI-Assisted Generation of Customizable Sign Language Videos With Enhanced Realism","snippet":"","ref_id":{"turn_index":0,"ref_type":"academia","ref_index":52},"pub_date":null,"attribution":"arxiv.org"},{"type":"search_result_group","domain":"synthesia.io","entries":[{"type":"search_result","url":"https://www.synthesia.io/post/best-video-translator-apps?utm_source=chatgpt.com","title":"The 6 Best AI Video Translator Apps of 2025 (Compared) - Synthesia","snippet":"The Best AI Video Translation Apps: Synthesia; Maestra; Elevenlabs; Kapwing; Veed; Rask AI. response_text: Here are some AI tools/apps that change the language of videos (translate + dub or add subtitles):  Online/web-based AI video translators  HeyGen (AI Video Translator) — translates videos into 175+ languages with AI voices and lip sync. HeyGen [https://www.heygen.com/translate]  Dubly.AI — automatic video translation with voice cloning and synced lip movement. Dubly.AI [https://dubly.ai/]  Rask.ai — localize and dub videos in 130+ languages. Rask [https://www.rask.ai/]  Maestra.ai — translate videos into 125+ languages with AI dubbing/subtitles. Maestra AI+1 [https://maestra.ai/]  Vozo.ai — AI video translator with voice cloning and lip sync. Vozo [https://www.vozo.ai/video-translate]  Mobile apps  AI Video Translator & Dubbing (Android) — app that dubs and subtitles videos in 40+ languages. Google Play [https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?hl=en_US&id=ai.voiser.aidubbing]  Dub AI (iOS/Android) — translates and lip-sync dubs videos using AI. App Store [https://apps.apple.com/us/app/dub-ai-video-translator-app/id6612030937]  AI Video Translator (iOS) — app on App Store that translates video audio to multiple languages. App Store [https://apps.apple.com/us/app/ai-video-translator/id6467438215]  Other options  Speechify AI Dubbing — browser tool for AI dubbing. Speechify [https://speechify.com/dubbing/?srsltid=AfmBOooz360fGrD3z5_Vkq0H2CLEvf_a4ixdyxe2GYDbyOKNR5l8y9xO]  If you want a specific recommendation (iOS, Android, free, best accuracy), tell me your platform.
